Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Comparable \Com"pa*ra*ble\, a. [L. comparabilis: cf. F. comparable.] Capable of being compared; worthy of comparison. [1913 Webster]
There is no blessing of life comparable to the enjoyment of a discreet and virtuous friend. --Addison. -- {Com"pa*ra*ble*ness}, n. -- {Com"pa*ra*bly}, adv. [1913 Webster]

comparable adj 1: able to be compared or worthy of comparison [ant: {incomparable}] 2: conforming in every respect; "boxes with corresponding dimensions"; "the like period of the preceding year" [syn: {corresponding}, {like}]
